page.title: 11Simon's Sand Pit
page.content:
There are few sources of good {building sand}available in Jersey and the major supplies come from this sand pit. the pit itself is subject to planning controls and, as a consequence, the workings are surrounded by a considerable bank of vegetated sand. Other abandoned sand pits have been filled and returned to sandy grassland.
{Building}in the area is severely restricted and the only ones along the coast are those that were there before the Second World War. One farmhouse has been replaced with a crazy golf course. {German}gun emplacements and other bunkers are now regarded as part of the historical scene and remain as witness, along with the reinforced concrete sea wall, to the 5 years of German occupation.
